August Link Dump

Finally it's super easy to make your own card and board games.  Someone must have realized how many times people have gotten all excited to make a game, then had all their energy go to waste when they realized how hard it is to get such a game published. I'm really picky about sneakers.  These make a bold statement without being goofy, which is hard to find. I've gotten the feeling that The Sims 3 is only fun when you don't play it the way it was meant to be played.  If the hilarity issued by this article is any indication, I may be right. A couple more stock sites that don't make me want to cry. It's hard to find an API that you can get excited about.  Mixpanel (a web analytics service) actually sounds like it'd be enjoyable to integrate. Shockingly reasonable advice.  Though people seem to disagree on a lot of these, the emphasis here is on emerging norms. My current favorite web programming editor. I love dark web design.  Here is an article that talks about how to do it well. Nambu is my desktop Twitter client de jour. This timeline of evolution on Earth, starting at the beginning, is fascinating. A wonderful tool for designers that determines the font used in an uploaded image.
